results.title: On the thread of a tale
results.creator_credit: Constantin Mustetea and Animation Film Studio
results.brief_description: Animated fairy tale with characters created out of a gradually unwinding ball of yarn. Depicts the adventures of Prince Charming and his fabulous horse, in search of his ladylove who has been captured by an ogre.

results.title: Of men and ideas
results.creator_credit: Ed Weiss, Ed Wegener and WOI Television
results.brief_description: Indicates that in the broadest sense general semantics is concerned with the factors in communication that lead to misunderstanding, tension and conflict. The film identifies and discusses four elements generally associated with most human behaviour. Makes the point that, in terms of resultant behaviour, we ought to be able to distinguish between assessments that make sense and those that do not.

results.title: Oddities of the law. No. 1. Laws of the road
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at several quirks in local road law. Short scenes dramatise the consequences of such laws, providing ample humour with: the New Hampshire ruling that when tow cars arrive at an intersection, neither can go until the other has passed; the New Mexico statute that forbids cars with “inharmonious” horns; the California law that forbids bicycles from over-taking firetrucks; and the Milwaukee by-law that states that no vehicle can park in one place for more than two hours unless it is attached to a horse.

results.title: Odd man in
results.creator_credit: Kevin Murray and Bairnsdale Technical School
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the star batsman (the “hero”) being bowled first ball. This film made by fifth form students of Bairnsdale Technical School, was an experiment to find the shortest film that could be made without crippling the educational worth of the project, which was completed in a month, with minimum expense. Eight periods of class time were spent out of doors in actual filming. For the other three weeks, students wrote the script and edited the film under normal classroom conditions.

results.title: Oasis in space: what price progress?
results.creator_credit: Andrew W Sott, Philippe Cousteau, Andrew Solt Productions and Costeau Society Production
results.brief_description: Affects of pollution (asbestos) on drinking water in area of Silver bay in US. Goes through how they analyse content of water and methods of how to reverse the situation of environmental disaster. Narrator, Philippe Cousteau.

results.title: Oasis in space: population time-bomb
results.brief_description: Discussion of world growth and how this affects economy, health, wealth and social conditions of world communities. Focuses on exponential growth, discussing the fast growth rate of the world; developing world countries affected by poverty, covering different viewpoints and theories; historical and political uprisings such as El Salvador etc. Discuses the methods of overcoming population growth in poorer countries through education and health. Different view points are expressed including those of: Dr Margaret Mead, Carl Sagan. Paul Ehrlich, Isaac Asimov and Yves Cousteau.
